intro: Ruyschiana fruticulosa, commonly known as the red-flowered buckthorn, is a shrub native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit and small, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright red berries that are a key feature of its botanical appearance. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Ruyschiana fruticulosa is often found in dry, sunny environments such as scrublands and rocky slopes.
